title: Amal Jyothi College of Engineering, Kottayam
meta_description: Amal Jyothi College of Engineering - [AJCE], Kanjirappally, Kerala Application Form, Admissions, Contact, Website, Map, B.Tech, B.Tech {Lateral}, BCA + MCA . 35 Courses. Average Fees is 100500 per year.

Section.name: About AJCE
Section.description:
Amal Jyothi College of Engineering, Kottayam established in 2001 under Diocese Educational Trust, Kanjirappally. It is affiliated to APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University (KTU), Kottayam. It is approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), New Delhi and accredited by National Board of Accreditation (NBA), New Delhi.
Departments
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Department of Electronics & Communication Engineering
Department of Electrical & Electronics Engineering
Department of Mechanical Engineering
Department of Civil Engineering
Department of Chemical Engineering
Department of Automobile Engineering
Department of Computer Applications
Collaboration
University of Ontario Institute of Technology (UOIT), Canada
Deakin University, Australia
Dr. MGR University, Chennai
Facilities
Computer Lab
The institute has a state of the art computer lab with 1000 PC’s which are well equipped with latest softwares and configurations.
Central Library
The institute has fully furnished library which is spread over three floors of 30000 sq ft area. It has a separate reference section, reading room, periodical section and stack area. It has a collection of 951 titles and 32000 volumes of books. It subscribes to 106 printed national & international journals. It also has 1851 no. of audio visual CD’s.
Hostel
Available for boys and girls students separately with combined accommodation capacity of 2200 students.
Sports Achievements
The college bagged the Overall Championship in the ‘PACE 14’ All Kerala Inter Collegiate Sports fest organized by St.Josephs college of Engineering, Pala.
The College Volleyball team secured the First position in the ‘PACE 14’ All Kerala Inter Collegiate Sports fest organized by St.Josephs college of Engineering, Pala.
The College Cricket team secured the First position in the ‘PACE 14’ All Kerala Inter Collegiate Sports Fest 14 organized by St.Josephs college of Engineering, Pala.
The College Table Tennis team secured the Second position in the All Kerala Inter Collegiate Invitational Table Tennis Championship 14 organized by St.Alberts College, Ernakulan.
The College Basketball team Participated in the All Kerala Invitational Basketball tournament 14 organized by YMCA, Nedumkunnam.

Balu S. Pillai Memorial Scholarship

Award of Excellence from M/s Sunny Diamonds
